value: Indians Catching Fish with the Help of Pelicans, plate 23 in the Venationes Ferarum, Avium, Piscium series

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. An inlet, with men standing on shore on both sides, watching the pelicans gather fish in their pouches. Each bird bears a ring about its throat to prevent it from swallowing its catch. In the foreground, right, a pelican dislodges the fish before its master. Near left center: "Ioan. Stradanus invent."; near lower right: "Carol de Mallery Sculp"; at lower right: "Phls Galle excud." Below: "ANSERIS INSTAR AUEM FOELIX..."

label: Provenance
value: Ex Collection: Mrs. A. W. Erickson

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. A. W. Erickson

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Using decoys to capture geese. The decoys are worn on the head, while the hunter immerses himself in the water, leaving only the bird-shaped headgear on the surface. Bearing a substance which attracts the birds, the alight and are caught by hand. One hunter walks from the water, right, wearing his decoy hat and carrying two birds. At lower left: "Ioan. Stradanus invent."; left center: "Corn. Galle Sculp."; lower right: "Phls. Galle excud." Below: "ANSERUM AGRESTE GENUS..."

label: Provenance
value: Ex Collection: Mrs. A. W. Erickson

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. A. W. Erickson
Elephants Helding Each Other out of a Trap, plate 1 from the Venationes Ferarum, Avium, Piscium series

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. An elephant is trapped in a deep pit, in the middle ground. Other elephants carry stones and tree trunks in an effort to rescue him. Inscribed on stone, near left center: "Ioan Stradanus invent. / Ioan Collaert Sculp." At lower right: "Phls Galle excud." Below: HUNC SERVANT MOREM NATURAE INSTINCTII ELEPHANTIS...

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. A. W. Erickson
Fight between Elephants and Snakes, plate 2 from the Venationes Ferarum, Avium, Piscium series

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. An elephant is attacked by a serpent, right foreground. Another serpent, in a tree, left, watches an approaching elephant. In the background, Troglodytes cut up and carry off the carcass of an elephant. Left of center, below: "Ioan Stradanus invent."; right of center, below: "Carol de Mallery Sculp."; lower right: "Phls Galle excud." Below: "EXCELSA IN BARRUM DRACO SESE EX ARBORE IACTAT..."

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. A. W. Erickson
Cavemen Chasing Elephants, plate 3 from the Venationes Ferarum, Avium, Piscium series

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. In center foreground, an elephant is attacked from the rear by one of the pygmies, while two others prepare to leap from the tree, left. In the background, the Troglodytes are cutting up and carrying off the carcass of an elephant. At left center: "Ioan. Stradanus invent. / Ioan Collaert Sculp"; right of center, below: "Phls. Galle excud." Below: "Trogloditae insidijs Elephantem."

label: Provenance
value: Ex. Collection: Mrs. A. W. Erickson

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. A. W. Erickson
A Roman Soldier Fighting one of Hannibal's Elephants, pl. 7 in the Venationes Ferarum, Avium, Piscium series

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Public combat between armeed warriors and an elephant. All of the warriors have fallen, except one, who faces the elephant, his sword upraised. A portion of the elephant's trunk has been severed. Spectators in enclosures, right and rear. Left to center, below: "Ioan. Stradanus invent. / Carol de Mallery Sculp. / Phls Galle excud." Below: "ANNIBAL IN BELLO CAPTOS CONFLIGERE COGIT..."

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. A. W. Erickson

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. The lions, frightened by the lighted torches carried by the hunters, are forced into the string of nets set up to trap them, right. At lower left: "Ioan. Stradanus invent." Right of center, below: "Ioan. Collaert Sculp."; at lower right: "Phls Galle excud." Below: "AS TU QUI SATAGUNT VALIDUM ILLAGUEARE LEONEM..."

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. A. W. Erickson

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Hunters on horseback lasso a bull, foreground, with the performance repeated in the background. At lower right: "Ioan. Stradanus invent. / Ioan. Collaert Sculp. / Phls. Galle excudit." Below: "SARDI EQUITIES HAS TIS TAUROS SECTANTUR AGRESTES."

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. A. W. Erickson
Buffalo Hunt, plate 27 in the Venationes Ferarum, Avium, Piscium series

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Hunters on horseback and on foot, armed with spears, have surrounded a group of oxen. The hunters' dogs attack one animal, foreground. At lower left: "Ioan Stradanus invent. Ioan. Collaert Sculp." At right: "Phls. Galle excud." Below: "BUBALUS AGRESTIS, RABIDUS, TRUX ET FERUS EST BOS..."

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. A. W. Erickson

label: Description
value: A perspective view of a large entrance hall, looking toward the staircase. A high ceiling, covered by a timber roof of the collar-braced type, in the English Gothic style. Left, elaborate mantelpiece and doorway on wall. Right, doorway and window on wall.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. A. W. Erickson

label: Description
value: Man's cap of yellow silk taffeta made up of four panels with a deep turn-up cuff. Embroidered with symmetrical chinoiserie floral sprays in satin stitch in blue ombre silk, and in bouclé stitch in silver metallic yarns. With silver metallic bobbin lace covering the four seams and edging the cuff.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic yarn (silver foil wrapped around silk core), flat foil strip Technique: embroidered in satin stitches on plain weave Label: silk embroidered with silk, metallic yarns and flat foil strip in satin stitch; metallic bobbin lace

label: Dimensions
value: H x circumference: 22.2 x 60 cm (8 3/4 x 23 5/8 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline E. Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Tall man's nightcap with deep bicorne cuff in salmon-colored ribbed silk, brocaded with a symmetrical floral design in silver metallic yarns and blue, green, yellow, pink, and white silks.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic yarn (metal foil wound around silk core) and flat foil strips Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary wefts (brocading) Label: silk and metallic brocade

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline E. Greenleaf

label: Notes
value: Tall man's nightcap with deep bicorne cuff in salmon-colored ribbed silk, brocaded with a symmetrical floral design in silver metallic yarns and blue, green, yellow, pink, and white silks.

label: Description
value: Man's nightcap made of four panels of undyed ribbed cotton with fairly deep cuff, piped along four seams and top of cuff with blue silk; topped with silk and metallic tassel.  Embroidered with bright crewel wool yarns in chain stitch with symmetrical flower spray in each panel, floral scroll along cuff.  Unlined.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool embroidery on linen and cotton ground, silk binding, silk and metallic tassel Technique: embroidered using chain, buttonhole and stem stitches on plain weave Label: linen and cotton embroidered with wool in chain, buttonhole and stem stitches; silk binding, silk and metallic tassel

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 22.9 x 17.8 cm (9 x 7 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline E. Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Baby's cap of fine white cotton ornamented with Hollie Point lace, a type of knotted needle lace, and white embroidery. Made in twelve sections and jointed by fine openwork stitches and decorated with scattered flower sprays of white embroidery. Sections run from front to back and join a small round crown of Hollie Point lace in a fruit basket design. Center panel and back and top of the cap are made of Hollie Point lace.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, linen Technique: knotted needle lace (Hollie Point)

label: Dimensions
value: H x W (profile): 17 x 13 cm (6 11/16 x 5 1/8 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline E. Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Full three-quarter length sleeve of fine silk machine embroidered with a floral pattern in white silk floss and gathered to a small straight white satin cuff.

label: Description
value: Small-scale allover design of diamonds framed within interlocking S-scroll borders in black and yellow silk with accents of dark red wool, white cotton, and turquoise blue silk. Incomplete border section in red and white.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, cotton, wool Technique: slit and interlocking tapestry

label: Description
value: Brown paper, wide stripes in aniline blue, scattered flower clusters on the latter in drop repeat.

label: Provenance
value: Unused length purchased for Schloss Weikersheim, Wurttenberg, Germany.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Vining floral pattern, printed in black, with background of leaves forming bullets, printed in gray, on green ground.

label: Physical description
value: Block printed on handmade paper, glazed

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: A delicate climbing floral with multi-colored flowers and two larger roses as the major motifs. Interspersed are light white sprays with mica. Drop match.

label: Physical description
value: Block-printed on joined sheets of handmade paper, mica

label: Provenance
value: Unused length purchased for Schloss Weikersheim, Wurttemberg, Germany.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Gray and yellow scrollwork with vases with jewelled decoration. Twisting leaves and ropes of flowers and fruit. Ornamented band at left. Printed on glazed blue ground.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Gray and yellow scrollwork with vases with jewelled decoration. Twisting leaves and ropes of flowers and fruit. Printed on glazed blue ground.

label: Dimensions
value: Overall: 265.4 x 50 cm (8 ft. 8 1/2 in. x 19 11/16 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Unused length purchased for Schloss Weikersheim, Wurttemberg, Germany. Submitted to Prince Hohenlohe-Langenburg by Frans Philipp Rossat Geiller ofWurzburg, 19 May, 1841. It was ordered for Weikersheim 25 June and Rosat was obliged to send for more from the manufacturer in Lyon as he did not have sufficient on hand.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Panels framed in grisaille containing alternately a mask centered within leaf forms and griffons, and a jewelled escutcheon. Below, a grisaille band along which at regular intervals are yellow gems.

label: Physical description
value: Block-printed on satin ground, continuous paper

label: Provenance
value: Unused length purchased for Schloss Weikersheim, Wurttenberg, Germany. Submitted to Prince Hohenlohe-Langnburg by Franz Philipp Rossat Geiller of Wurzburg, 19 May 1841. It was ordered for Weikersheim, 25 June, and Rossat was obliged to send for more from the manufacturer in Lyon as he didnot have sufficient on hand.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Five different medallions alternating vertically with one constant smaller one. The scenes in the five large medallions show figures in 17th century costume against architectural and scenic backgrounds. About sixteen colors on polished or satin gray ground.

label: Provenance
value: Unused end of wallpaper placed on the walls of a bedroom at Schloss Weikersheim. See green Catherine Lynn binder for in-situ photographs.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: A band of alternating oval and rectangular medallions along the upper edge. Below this a long enframed medallion stretching horizontally. Foliate clusters interrupt the latter from above and below at the medallion's center point. The same cluster form alternates horizontally with the large medallion.

label: Physical description
value: Block-printed on continuous paper, polished ground

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Vertical series of upside down heart-shaped medallions, brown and bright green, alternating with white foliate and scroll motif. To right and left, vertical moldings bound at intervals with a leaf. Printed in colors on polished or satin ground.

label: Physical description
value: Block printed on continuous paper, polished ground

label: Provenance
value: In Weikersheim bedroom used between panels of 1952-52-15, fulfilling function as pilaster and border. See green Catherine Lynn binder for in-situ photographs.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Almost four complete horizontal repeats of a Gothic arch of stone elaborately carved and heavily enriched with flowers and plant forms. Printed in white and brownish-green on pale green ground.

label: Provenance
value: Unused length originally purchased for the decoration of Schloss Weikersheim, Wurttemberg, Germany.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Horizontal band of clusters of leaves and clusters of flowers connected by stems. Blue flowers and green and white flowers. Yellow and green leaves. Printed on red ground.

label: Provenance
value: Unused length originally purchased for the decoration of Schloss Weikersheim, Wurttemberg, Germany.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Grisaille roses in random arrangement on greenish-gray moire ground.

label: Provenance
value: Unused length intended for the decoration of Schloss Weikersheim, Wurttemberg, Germany.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Same design as 1952-52-19 but leaf cluster, and dentil molding at bottom, are in orange flock. Also one of the flower clusters is yellow and green instead of white and green. Clusters of leaves and clusters of flowers connected by stems as above. Printed on white glazed ground.

label: Physical description
value: Block-printed and flocked on handmade paper, glazed

label: Provenance
value: Unused length purchased for the decoration of Schloss Weikersheim, Wurttemberg, Germany.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Orange and green acanthus leaves twist around a horizontal orange rod. Printed on gray glazed ground.

label: Provenance
value: Unused length purchased for the decoration of Schloss Weikersheim, Wurttemberg, Germany.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Scrollwork sparingly embellished with blue and yellow beads. Blue and yellow flowers with green leaves are found in the openings of the grisaille framework. (A fourth length may have been clipped from this width).

label: Provenance
value: Unused length purchased for the decoration of Schloss Weikersheim, Wurttemberg, Germany.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Grisaille and blue scrollwork motif alternating with medallion enclosing diaper of red flock rosettes on white glazed ground in diagonal pattern. At least one edge has probably been clipped. Printed and flocked on white glazed ground.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Grisaille rococo scrollwork with leaf forms, enclosing medallions. The latter are embellished with black strapwork scrolls and leaf forms on blue ground. (Probably clipped on one side or both. Were probably two or more lengths to a width originally). Printed on blue ground.

label: Provenance
value: Unused length purchased for the decoration of Schloss Weikersheim, Wurttemberg, Germany.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Grisaille scrollwork leaving open areas of red. The latter are embellished with black scroll and leaf forms. Grisaille dentil moldings along the upper and lower edges. (Other lengths have probably been clipped from this). Printed on red ground.

label: Provenance
value: Unused length purchased for the decoration of Schloss Weikersheim, Wurttemberg, Germany.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Grisaille scrollwork frames enclosing, alternately, a cluster of flowers and leaves on gray ground, and a smaller cluster on a red ground which is striped with black. Grisaille moldings along upper and lower edges. (Probably clipped along both edges).

label: Provenance
value: Unused length purchased for the decoration of Schloss Weikersheim, Wurttemberg, Germany.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: White foliate scrolls and flowers, roughly symmetrical in arrangement. Straight-across match.

label: Provenance
value: Unused lenth purchased for Schloss Weikersheim, Wurttemberg, Germany.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Enframed clusters of flowers in drop repeating arrangement. Scroll and flower enframements. The major clusters have touches of orange. All other elements are gray and white.

label: Provenance
value: Unused length purchased for Schloss Weikersheim, Wurttemberg, Germany.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: A series of vertical bands along which are scroll and leaf medallions alternating with smaller floral clusters. Along every other band the motifs are turned 90 degrees, or turned over, and are dropped.

label: Provenance
value: Unused length purchased for Schloss Weikersheim, Wurttemberg, Germany.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: A series of vertical bands along which are scroll and leaf medallions alternating with smaller floral clusters. Along every other band the motifs are turned 90 degrees, or turned over, and are dropped.

label: Provenance
value: Unused length purchased for Schloss Weikersheim, Wurttemberg, Germany.
